config.question: Which of the following best demonstrates Republican economic policies of the 1920s?

choices.content: The secretary of the interior helped oil promoters secure leases on naval reserves.
The Volstead Act banned most commercial production and distribution of alcohol.
The Eighteenth and Nineteenth amendments were passed in Congress.
Congress cut the highest income tax bracket.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Secretary of the Treasury Andrew Mellon pressed for repealing an excess profits tax on corporations and slashing personal rates on the rich. See L.O. 25.4 How did the politics of the 1920s reflect changes in the economy and in American society?
